Shared resource pool for multiple Azure SQL Databases (cost effective for varying loads)
Blended measure of CPU, Memory, Data I/O, and Log I/O in Azure SQL
Pricing model based on separate compute (cores) and storage (GB) selection
Azure tier supporting up to 100TB databases with rapid scaling
Auto-pausing/resuming and auto-scaling compute based on workload
Replicating database to secondary region for DR (Readable secondaries)
Manages replication and failover of a group of databases to another region
Connecting to Azure services via private IP in VNet (security)
Integrated analytics service (Big Data + Data Warehousing)
Core technology for loading data from Data Lake Store into SQL tables
Node that manages query distribution (Brain of the architecture)
Node that executes the query portions on its data slice
Strategy for placing data rows across compute nodes
Higher compression level for rarely accessed data (slower to read)
Allowing index creation to pause and resume (SQL 2019+)

q: What is 'TempDB Metadata Contention' fix in 2019?

o: Feature using Persistent Version Store (PVS) for instant rollback/recovery regardless of transaction size
Storage for row versions in the user database (enabling ADR)
Zero-copy access to data pages on PMEM (Optane)
Querying data at source without moving it (PolyBase)
Deployment of SQL Server + Spark + HDFS in Kubernetes
The SQL Server instance that manages the cluster and external tables
Instances providing data persistence and caching for HDFS data
Instances providing computational power for distributed queries
Command-line utility to manage BDC and Azure Arc
Running Azure data services (SQL MI, PostgreSQL) on any infrastructure (On-prem, AWS, Google)
Mechanism to evaluate SQL Server config against best practices

q: What is 'Notebook' in Azure Data Studio?
o: Document containing executable code (SQL/Python) and rich text (Markdown)
Cross-platform lightweight database management tool (Electron based)
ADS is cross-platform/modern UI; SSMS is Windows-only/full-feature admin
The format execution plans are saved in (.sqlplan)
When a new execution plan performs worse than the old one
Automatic forcing of the last known good plan if regression is detected (requires Query Store)
Cost metric of the last executed query
Number of cores used for a parallel operator
Construct preventing parallel plan (e.g. Scalar UDF, Modify Table Var)
Spool operator added to plan to separate read/write phases
Optimization for Hash Joins (builds bitmap of keys to filter probe side early)
Mechanism to bring pages into buffer pool before they are requested by query
Reading/Writing multiple non-contiguous memory/disk segments in one call
Root of the SQL Server encryption hierarchy (protects DMKs)
Key used to protect certificates and asymmetric keys in a database
